disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you intentionally fail to respect the prescribed days of fasting, such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did you publicly mock the Church, causing offense to its members?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

condoning.question: Did I, in conversation with other Catholics, give my approval to them staying away from Sacraments or Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: from participating in Sacraments or Mass
condoning.question: Did I, through my words, lead fellow Catholics away from participating in Sacraments or Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did you fail to provide necessary support when someone was struggling financially, although you had the means to do so?
condoning.description: As part of the corporal works of mercy, we're called to be merciful and compassionate to those in distress.

condoning.question: Did I fail to speak truthfully to my child about their wrongdoing, instead choosing to avoid an uncomfortable conversation?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not buried?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished for those around me to experience setbacks in their pursuits, perhaps causing them to envy my own successes?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that was hurtful , rude , or unbecoming
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in a way that was hurtful, rude, or unbecoming?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in my conversations with others, using language that was inappropriate and demeaning to them?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and use language that was hurtful or degrading to others in conversations, either online or offline?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Have I overindulged in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, thereby succumbing to gluttony?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
especially during social gatherings or when engaging in leisure activities
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially during social gatherings or when engaging in leisure activities?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than eating and drinking in a way that honors God
in a way that honors God
gluttony.question: Did you allow your desire for good food and drink to lead you to overindulge, rather than eating and drinking in a way that honors God?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: on discretionary activities or luxuries that take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs
over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I excessive and wasteful spending on discretionary activities or luxuries that take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Do I have excessive and wasteful spending that takes precedence over my financial responsibilities, potentially harming those who rely on me?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: through conversations or discussions with friends , family , or acquaintances
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true, through conversations or discussions with friends, family, or acquaintances?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing my acquaintances ' personal matters
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing my acquaintances' personal matters, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in activities on Sunday that could have been postponed or avoided , potentially desecrating the Lord 's Day
impiety.question: Did I engage in activities on Sunday that could have been postponed or avoided, potentially desecrating the Lord's Day?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
